newsitem.title: UK: INSIGHT - Sterling eyes test higher to $1.63.
newsitem.headline: INSIGHT - Sterling eyes test higher to $1.63.

text.p: Sterling looked set to test higher ground against the dollar, eyeing initial resistance at $1.6290/6300, but the recent rangebound conditions are likely to make progress slow, said chartists.
The $1.6290 level is a recent top reinforced by round-figure resistance at $1.63.

"Cable is in sideways mode but it does look better value on the upside than sterling/mark," said Norman Beauchamp, head of derivatives at Co-Operative Bank in London. "There is bullish divergence on the stochastics and we could see a move to the top of a wedge formation around $1.6347."
